data.title: Duke football, fall sports to begin without fans
data.meta_description: Duke University announced Monday that it will begin fall sports home events without spectators this season due to the...
data.text:
Duke University announced Monday that it will begin fall sports home events without spectators this season due to the impact of COVID-19.

“To be sure, our venues will not be the same without our passionate, energetic fan base,” vice president and director of athletics Kevin White said in a news release. “Given the unique and challenging circumstances, this determination was reached with the health and safety of our fans, student-athletes, coaches and staff at the forefront. As this evolving process continues, it is imperative to be both adaptable and compliant in anticipation of hosting fans in the near future.”

Essential game management personnnel and broadcast media will be allowed to attend games, the release said.

Those who already have purchased season or single-game football tickets or have seating and suite contracts in Blue Devil Tower will be addressed via email, according to the release.

Duke will offer fan cutouts for sale, with proceeds benefiting Duke Athletics. More information is available at GoDuke.com/DukeCutout.

Duke opens its football season against Boston College on Sept. 19. Schedules for men’s and women’s cross country, field hockey, men’s and women’s soccer and volleyball have yet to be released.
